snippet: The jurors in the trial of R. Allen Stanford have been unable to reach a unanimous verdict on 14 counts of financial fraud after four days.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge David Hittner, overseeing fraud trial of financier Robert Allen Stanford, orders the jury to return to deliberations after it said it could not reach a unanimous verdict on each of the 14 counts in its fourth day of reviewing the evidence.
lead_paragraph: The jurors in the trial of R. Allen Stanford have been unable to reach a unanimous verdict on 14 counts of financial fraud after four days.

headline.seo: Jury Told to Keep Talking in Stanford Fraud Trial
headline.main: Jurors Told to Keep Talking in Financier’s Fraud Trial
headline.print_headline: Jurors Told to Keep Talking In Financier’s Fraud Trial
